I decided to stop here for a quick breakfast since I was craving somthing sweet. When I walked in the first thing I noticed was that the bakery was extremely cute and had a nice aesthetic to it. 

I ordered the nutella and banana crepe and a creme filled Chouquette. Both were just as good as I hoped they would be. There isnt much seating indoors but there is additional seating in a beautiful outside.

The only issue is that everything looks so good that you will have a difficult time deciding what you want.

I had high expectations, considering the fact that this bakery receives rave reviews over their pastries and croissants. I've been looking for a decent French bakery in the area to hold a candle to my favorite place in Paris, so I ordered a pain au chocolat and an apple turnover. The bakery is very cute, offers a variety of desserts and serves La Columbe coffee. When I opened the bag to eat my pain au chocolat, I noticed that the bake was a little dark. The croissant was crisp with decent air pockets, but there was a bitter aftertaste that I didn't like, perhaps it was the chocolate, but I wasn't blown away. The apple turnover was soggy and filled with apple sauce. I was expecting the apple turnover to be filled with pieces of apple, but this was unappetizing and I could not finish it. This is a decent spot if you're looking for an "ok" pastry and some coffee, but this turned out to be a disappointment for me.

Such an awesome addition to the neighborhood! It's so nice to have such a bright, clean space to visit when you're treating yourself. The raisin roll is my current favorite but I've tried nearly everything and it's all amazing. They also serve La Colombe and have draft lattes which is a bonus!

Awesome French bakery! My boyfriend and I stopped in to grab coffee and some treats (they have La Colombe on draft). The almond croissant was great, but the chocolate almond croissant pretzel thing was the absolute best - definitely get that. They also have a few tables outside.

Really cute bakery and coffee shop. The staff is very friendly and the space itself is small, clean, and bright. I stopped in with see girlfriends to get some coffee and some dessert that we didn't need but couldn't resist ordering. 

They have La Colombe coffee including the draft lattes. My friend got the draft latte but unfortunately it tasted off the day we went. She mentioned to staff and they immediately replaced it with a drink of her choice which I thought was a really nice touch. I had a latte with soy milk which was very tasty. 

The desserts are all gorgeous. If I was hungrier I probably could have gotten everything there. 

We ended up getting a Madeline (not pictured), the choquette (puff pastry with airy chocolate cream) and the Napoleon (the last two are pictured with this review). All were good but the Napoleon (the heart shaped dessert) was stand out. The cream was so friggin delicious I am still thinking about it days later. 

If I'm in the neighborhood I would definitely stop by here for coffee and sweets.

Great spot for a morning breakfast/brunch. Best Napoleon I've had in awhile. It consisted of light, flaky layers dusted with sugar and filled with delicious cream. I miss the pastries in Paris and this place definitely lives up to the expectations!
Such a cute little bakery!! I love the vibe here. Definitely gonna be a favorite place of mine!!!

This place stole our hearts as soon as we entered the first time, it's so romantic and French and it smells so good!! We tried different pastries and liked them all, but our favorite is the chocolate éclair, just like in Paris!

Close your eyes and you could be in France. Pastries are beautiful, lovely and so well done. I had been in nyc eating at bakeries the day before... this little gem blew them away. The space is so well done. I will be back often.
Great coffee and day old treats freshly decadent none the less! Stop by for a warm pick me up it's blustery out there

Cute little french bakery, with a wide selection of pastries to eat. Also great ambiance to do some work as it wasn't too loud and wifi was speedily fast, and they make a wide selections of coffees. Baristas were really friendly and accomodating, and their coffees (got an Iced latte for ~$3) was surprisingly good and tasty. Lots of tables at back to do work and sit. The whole decor feels like your transported to a coffee shop in Paris, and a cool place to hangout with a friend or invite a date over. Would definitely come back here!

Waaaaaay too convenient to the PATCO stop at 12th and Locust.

This sleek, bright and airy coffee and pastry shop is adorable, with big open doors / windows that open up to the street when the weather is nice.

It's no Dunkin Donuts. You're going to pay a fairly expensive price for handmade pastries and strong coffee.

Pay up, pick a seat and relax. Pretend that instead of downtown Philly, you're at a French patisseries in Paris. Minus the smoking. And petite yappie dogs sitting beside you in a chair.
Good pastries and coffee. Day old bag for $3 full of goodies. Would definitely recommend

J'aime is a solid go-to whenever we are craving some pastries. It's a popular spot on the weekends, so go early as they tend to sell out of items. 

I have been a fan of everything I've tried there so far. The sweet items are just the right amount of sweet and everything is baked to flaky perfection. I haven't tried any of their drinks, but it seems like a regular morning coffee spot for many.

As of right now there is limited indoor seating and a couple outdoor tables as well. Off the main street so it's nice and quiet, perfect for munching and people watching!

i love this place!! the bakery items are adorable and they have so many pastries!! the only downside is they don't have chai, which is the only thing i really drink since i'm not a coffee drinker! but the service is good and the ambience is stellar
Excellent croissants and tarts!  Yummy treat you should definitely walk to.  We were so happy with it we're going a second time this morning.

I took my son here after I had an appointment nearby and it was amazing. He had crepes with a coffee and I had an almond croissant. We also got a Napoleon to go. The service was great and the employees were very friendly. I look forward to going again.

Awesome pastry and coffee/tea shop in Center City. Great place to grab a latte and snack to do work or have a conversation. Beautiful and classy ambience. Very friendly staff and great customers. I would recommend checking out if you need somewhere to concentrate and do work. Many bakery selections and beverages to choose from.

Nice apple tart. 
Nice coffee (black coffee).
Great space to study or work.
No parking space but you can street parking.

A rare find in Philadephia as this bakery truly stands above the competition and is, in my view, one of the best French patisserie in the entire US. The staff is very friendly and I make sure to vista every time I am in Philadelphia. Never been disappointed by any of the pastries and their coffee is delicious too. Highly recommended.

Oh my goodness. Absolutely *the* cutest bakery I've ever been to. Everyone is so kind and have some of the best baked goods. I have a huge sweet tooth, so their apple turnovers and eclairs and pains au chocolate are some of my favorites. And they sell delish bottled fruit juices and other beverages, too. Oh, oh, oh! *And* they have Bonne Maman jellies and preserves! Absolutely *the* best you can buy. Occasionally they'll have the muscat grape jelly jam, which I cannot find *anywhere* else in the city.

What actually inspired me to write a review, though, is their baguettes. They have both French and sourdough. I can't speak to the sourdough ones, but the traditional French bread baguettes are so, so good. I cannot get enough and made it a regular treat before the apocalypse. Now I know they're open again I'll be making regular stops for more baguettes. Bread is love, bread is life, and good bread is good life!

Plus! The space is utterly charming and I feel like I could spend a day here. If only I had the time! I live just a block away and this adorable little spot has become a dear favorite of mine, a true staple of the community.

C'est vrai: J'aime French Bakery! 

The third time was the charm for me with this adorable new bakery. On my first attempt, I tried to meet Alisha S on a Monday, only to find that the shop is closed on Mondays. Alisha had arrived before me and walked in through the open doors. Though she was informed that they are not open on Mondays, the employees sent her away with some complimentary pastries - so nice! 

My second attempt was for a savory breakfast. Alas, there was no quiche left by the time I arrived, and I needed something substantial before my long day. 

Finally, another meeting with Alisha was scheduled and the bakery was both open and stocked with several quiche options! I ordered the quiche lorraine which came with a small side salad. It was absolutely perfect - decadent and just the right size for lunch. I haven't tried the sweet pastries yet, but there will be many more visits in the future. 

I'd love to see an enhanced menu of savory items (perhaps some baguette sandwiches?). Also, I'd REALLY love some wifi (but understand if they don't want to be the type of place where people like me stick around too long). In any case, looking forward to my next visit! À la prochaine!

This is a clean, well-lit, upscale place that I would love to go on a date/hang out with girlfriends in. Unfortunately, I wasn't equally impressed by the pastries. Nothing was bad, but the quality/flavor just didn't match the atmosphere.
The coffee's delicious, the pastries are delicious, and they have really nice deals like a sandwich and small drink for $9.95. Plus the staffs really friendly, great place!

Stumbled upon this place on a walk around philly musing over art murals on a rainy day and knew we had to pop in.

Loved the French, minimalist decorations, and the strong lattes. 

I posted a photo of the coffee shop and the space was so beautiful that my friends kept asking me where I found this gem!

I come here when I need a calming place to sip tea, nibble on pastries, and get some work done. I also love sitting by the big windows (inside in the winter or out on the sidewalk in the summer) with a friend and watching all the neighborhood pups trot by. The staff is friendly, the pastries are scrumptious, and the ambiance is lovely. Also great for a quick but elegant European breakfast; if I'm in a rush, I'll grab a pastry and a latte on my way to work.

Very cute place with a ton of options. Cold brew on tap, coffee, tea, food. 

Important to note: their iced tea is only a hot water + teabag + ice. 

I ordered an iced tea (jasmine) and a Nutella and banana crepe. The tea was basic tea and the crepe was really good! A bit pricey at $7 but hot and melty. 

Very important: the crepe doesn't take good when it's not hot! Eat it quick. 

The staff was incredibly friendly and the experience was overall a good one. 

They have a customer limit of 7 and do enforce it. The baristas all wear masks.

A cute little place to stop by and grab your iced coffee to go. They do seasonal decorations and is a great neighborhood location for your cup of joe. The staff is friendly, the pastries are good (chocolate croissant here was great!), and if we lived closer, I would definitely come here on the reg.

My mother-in-Law is from France and she claims these are the best croissants she has had outside of France. And if you Know any French- you know that is not a statement they make lightly. This place can never ever close, it will break our hearts.  I hope this shop opens 20 more locations so more people can experience the joy of a warm flaky chocolate croissant.
They don't have any variety on desserts. They are little and quite expensive. Their coffee, on the other hand, is very good, it was the only thing I really enjoy.

Its clean, adorable decor caught my eye since its opening. The cafe serves La colombe coffee along with a wide variety of fresh pasties. I ordered a chocolate croissant (requested it to be warmed up) with a small cup of coffee.  Lots of cafes serve chocolate croissants but not many hit home like this one did - light and flakey with the perfect amount of chocolate. There are plenty of tables and windows, making it well lit and great spot to work. 

I live on the other side of Broad but I would make the walk again (and again) for more J'aime.
Beat bakery in Philadelphia! Love all of their items and the staff are super friendly!
Nicest employees. Very clean and COVID friendly! 10/10 recommend. Coffee is soooo good.
The cutest bakery and they sell my favorite lacolombe coffee and yummy pastries! definitely recommend

Came here a while back ago, and I have no idea where my review went, so I'm back again to do this place justice. Unfortunately no photos though for the previous time :(

Last time I got the chouquette, which is a big, incredibly yummy cream puff. Highly recommend! Back again now and the apple tart is just as good!

Really bright interior with lots of natural lighting. Definitely a great place to stop and have a nice chat.

Lovely french café. Very simple and straightforward, which is great. Would definitely recommend to stop by on the way to one of the parks around. 

Covid: masks on, limited capacity to 2 people at a time

Very fast service. Cute coffee shop
Good for a place to study or to come for a catch up/date - all the tables seem to fit two. 
They offer an array of pastries for very decent prices like croissant for $3 - and your typical cafe drinks.

I love this place. An authentic French bakery and coffee shop in the middle of Center City. Suffice to say, great croissants, good coffee and a wonderful atmosphere. My personal favorite is the smoked salmon on baguette with cream cheese and spinach. Love to sit outside and watch the world go by on a nice day. Très français!
J'aime kills it! Great pastries and awesome t-shirts! Will definitely go back anytime I'm in Philly.
A great little spot for a proper coffee and pastry. The quiche lorraine was spot on, light and savory with a flaky crust and splitting a Nutella crepe topped it off nicely.
Good spot for working. Wifi, reasonable plug situation, comfortable space, friendly staff.

Came here with a friend at the time to get some pastries and coffee. The person working counter may have been new or was getting into the groove of things, but he mixed up a lot of our orders at first. My friend stated that she wanted our orders separate, but they were all included together. Then, the lemon tart I ordered was placed in her bag and not mine, so we ended up sorting that out ourselves. In fairness to him too, there seemed to be only two people working at the time.

The almond croissant was a-okay. Not the most amazing thing I've had, but certainly not the worst. Layers of butter and dough were there and the filling was quite nice, not sickly sweet. The lemon tart was also okay. Honestly I feel it's basically a lemon bar in a cute shape with some meringue piped in a circle that was torched on top. It was a scorcher of a day, and sounded the most refreshing at the time, but maybe I just ordered wrong.

Overall, a nice little place to stop by if you're craving pastries, but I wouldn't say after my first visit it's a destination sort of place.

3.5 stars
I really like Jaime, and I think it's the best bakery in town. Especially their almond croissant and chocolate puff are very delicious.

When I had trouble choosing which pastries to share with a couple friends, I knew I'd be back at this elegant and quaint bakery shop. Even on a Sunday at 4pm, heart-shaped napoleons were just being placed onto the display case. The staff was friendly, and we were able to get refrigerated water in swing-top bottles, a nice touch. 

Tasting notes:
Napoleon-just enough custard cream in between lightly sugared, crisp puff pastry sheets
Paris Philadelphia-generous hazelnut cream that gushes upon first bite, with soft choux pastry topped with sliced almonds
Pain au chocolat-flaky and buttery with just enough chocolate folded in the layers to add flavor and texture

Tip: If you live in the area and find that you adore this place, definitely pick up a punch card-after 9 purchases, get a pastry, viennoiserie, or crepe for free!
Delicious pastries with great presentation, friendly service and cute interior! Have a variety of seasonal pastries as well. Would definitely recommend for a light breakfast place
The chocolate choquette is  a must have. Highly recommended! Also had the butter and ham sandwich. The baguette is of high quality!

Ambience. This is a bright cafe with huge windows, cute decor, and an open space. Sat down here on a Saturday to get some work and studying done, and I had the perfect table right by an outlet and next to a window. Was the perfect spot to spend a Saturday afternoon! 

The latte I got was fantastic, and the barista was wonderful. I had originally asked for my drink in a mug, but he told me I could get an extra shot for the same price in a paper cup. I'm all for staff helping me get my extra caffeine boost. Definitely coming back soon try out some of their baked goods!

It's hard to write a review based on my one experience with a bakery. Ordered Buche de Noel desert for Christmas as Metropolitan bakery was sold out. Was really excited to order it and the owner was really nice. Cake was creamy and tasty but I was so underwhelmed with how unimpressively decorated the cake was ( my family was too). 6 measly cranberries which didn't even look like real sugared cranberries, no greenery etc. I've seen unprofessional cakes decorated better. When it's ordered for a holiday table it's especially disappointing. We got some croissants as well. They were pretty good but not as good as in the French bakery near me ( La Baguette Magique). I would be hesitant to order the cake for occasion again . However, I'd stop again for coffee and pastry if in the neighborhood and will update the review.

Super cute place in Philadelphia. Picked up some pastries for breakfast. Place was very clean. Staff member was wearing a mask. Masks were not enforced for vaccinated customers. Croissants were $3/each which were amazingly delicious. So we're the raisin rolls. We also got the baguette which tasted gray as well. We literally wanted every item in there. I'm sure they also taste great!

Their bakeries are amazing not too sweet just nice. The atmosphere is pretty chill, suitable for people to do their work. The place is clean and neat. Workers are friendly and nice too. The price is reasonable not too pricey. First time coming here but I like it!

A very "french-y" bakery. Seems to be more emphasis on pastries than cakes since I didn't see many options on both days I had visited. Interesting comparison to Delice et Chocolat in Ardmore. Pastries seem delicate and elegantly made. I could only find such well made pastries mostly in Asian run/theme bakeries such as Paris Baguette or Hamada-ya. Pastries are flaky and yet not too greasy. Cream is velvety smooth and not too sweat. Savory quiche is creamy but not overwhelmingly heavy. Draft Lette has similar taste as cold brew and no sour after taste. Most people might find its deserts are on the "lighter" side, but it's a place I would love to visit again.

Brilliant French pastries and excellent coffee! The modern, bright, cozy atmosphere offers a great place to work on your laptop. One of my favorite cafes in Philly. So glad it survived the quarantine. I only wish they would stay open later.

Olive Oil Cake: 5/5
Almond Croissant: 5/5
Caramel Crepe: 4/5
French Jam Crepe: 3/5

I really enjoyed visiting this bakery! It was on a weekday, right before the store hours ended. It's a beautiful, quaint shop, with unique relaxing detail. The clerk was friendly and patient with me as I decided on what to get. Although the bakery was close to ending time, the pastries were still fresh and that makes all the difference! Happy to visit the bakery again!

This is honestly my favorite place in Philly. The pastries are TO. DIE. FOR. I lived in Paris for a short time and since then it's been so hard to find pastries that I'm not secretly judging but this place is the real deal !!! I've spent the last 5 years trying to find somewhere like this and it is amazing that I have just around the corner from where I work.

The atmosphere is so inviting, I want their designer to come decorate my house for me. A really beautiful place to sit and have a coffee. And it's always so clean which is important. 

The staff is extremely professional and prompt. I have never had even the slightest issue, and I frequent this place throughout the week. The owner is so friendly - AND SUPER HOT. I mean he looks like he should be on The Bachelor or something. And his French accent doesn't hurt his case either. But besides that, he always makes time to speak with his customers and he's simply a ray of sunshine. 

Overall, 10/10 would recommend and do recommend to everyone I know. If you haven't been here yet, you are certainly missing out.

I stopped in to get a couple of pastries as a treat for my family while I was visiting family in Philadelphia. 

The girl at the counter accommodated my request for packing the pastries and was really friendly while ringing my purchases up. 

Definitely going to bring my daughter next visit, she loved the desserts I brought home. Great cappuccino as well!

I was having French friends over for terrine de foie gras and cassoulet so I stopped at two Philly bakeries for pastry and baguettes. J'aime French Bakery has a great ambiance and the happy ghosts of the long gone Millenium Coffee (and Afterwords) that used to occupy the space.
Bright and cheerful, simple yet elegant - the visual appeal and feel is great.  I arrived early and my server was nice and cheerful, very helpful.  He seemed a bit chagrined when I purchased most of the stock that was set out - 3 each of: eclairs, pear tarts, orange tarts, blueberry tarts, 6 chocolate croissants, 4 sugar brioches, 3 chocolate brioches and two regular French baguettes.  It was too early for a few of the other items on the menu like the chocolate tartlet or the Paris Philadelphia.
Service was good and the pastries were overall pretty good and the baguettes were excellent.  One of our guests oversees the baking of croissants in France so he felt the chocolate croissant were a bit sloppy and as a baker of croissant and eclairs myself, I have to say I agreed.  They looked a bit hastily made but they tasted fine.  I still think that J'aime French Bakery was pretty good overall in spite of a few issues and so I still give them a 4.

The whole thing is in the hands of amateurs. When I was in France, the pastries and coffee were totally heavenly. J'aime is not bad but not so different from any decent bakery in Philadelphia such as Metropolitan. There is a huge difference between the driven American artisans who tried so hard to master French baking vs. the French who are more exposed to its cuisine but not so well trained. 

It's like I would rather drink technically well made Napa wine over mediocre French wine.
Simply lovely.  Nice ambience, perfect pastries.  We visited every day of our 3 days in Philadelphia. Felt transported to France.

I LOVE this place and have been here more than I should. Highly recommend the chocolate croissant (one of the best I've had outside of France), almond croissant, and the fruit tart. The madeleines are delicious as well. Everything is made fresh daily, and if you don't mind day-old pastries, you can buy a bag of yesterday's goodies for $3.

The bakery is well-lit and decorated, a clean and feminine feel to the space. Great for working next to the windows, or for an afternoon get together with a friend. Not the place I would pick for high quality coffee, but their croque-en-bouche impressed me. Definitely an affordable French bakery!

Espresso: on the bitter side, milk was oversteamed, chocolate seemed unsweetened (a nice change of pace from most mochas) 

Madeline: quite eggy and less buttery than I've had, but a nice homemade feel to it. 

Croque-en-bouche: light and fluffy, dough well cooked yet still moist, enjoyed the flaky sugar coating that nearly had a caramelized taste

Everything I have gotten here has been absolutely fantastic. It actually rivals some of the bakeries I visited in Montreal (maybe controversial words). I'm impressed that in a city not particularly known for its competitive viennoiserie, this place is French all around - from staff to its food, with attention to quality and executing the basics amazingly well.

My favorites have been the croissant and madeline, although it has been awhile since I have revisited. I'm glad I don't live nearby, because I'd make these items a daily part of my coffee routine. I think when they first opened, I filled an embarrassing number of punches in my punch card.

This place is worth supporting - you can see the hard work and thought put into executing their vision for a French bakery oasis, serving pastry striving to be as good as you'd get in French-speaking cities, among the hustle and bustle of Philly.

As a french guy, this is my go to for french baked goods in Philly.

Classic, and well executed paint au chocolat. 
Lovely pastries all around.

And some fun twist on some of the classics: Paris-Philadelphia (their version of the Paris-Brest).

yea this place is legit. would have to agree this is one of the best if not the best french bakery in the philly area. would venture to say quality-wise, on same level, probably better, than nyc commercialized french bakeries such as maison kayser. this is just a smaller operation with a personalized touch that you can taste and feel as soon as you step into this quaint bakery to the moment you devour all of the pastries they have to offer. you can even see the baker (himself?) in the back kitchen working diligently. 

just a glance at each of the individual pastries you can tell was conscientiously made and put together. it's the attention to detail on each piece, you can tell there is pride in the work, brings some nostalgia to how small patisseries used to operate. 

a true gem, hidden to me until now. 

things you have to try at least once- the apple croissant (best i've had) and the meringue fluffy dome thing (best i've had yet again, actually have never had anything like it but it is the perfect balance of fluff and crisp and chewy, you'll know what i mean on the first bite. my wife who doesn't really like meringue even was amazed. i guess it goes to show that sometimes you dont like a particular food until it's prepared the right way). 

oh and the lemon meringue tart is delectable. of course the croissants are great. the fruit tart is perfectly balanced. all of their creams/fillings are perfectly on point. 

my deepest compliments to the baker, and all the staff there including the  authentic french servers (always a good sign). 

per usual, i'm hesitant to post such reviews for fear that it will be discovered by the masses, but seems like they are already well on their way, and much deserved at that.

This place was so aesthetically pleasing and bright and turned out to be a nice study spot for me and my friends. There are some tables but not too many so if you get lucky, grab a table and spend the afternoon there! 

I got a latte and a chocolate croissant which were both good but not spectacular. Overall I would come back and have an afternoon coffee and snack and get studying done or have a cute little coffee date here!

In my search for the best croissant in Philly, it was only natural for me to visit J'aime if not for the sole reason that it's exceptionally close to me. The shop is cute, bright, and has a good amount of indoor seating space, perfect for a coffee date or if you're looking for a place to study or get work done. For the budget conscious viennoiserie lover, they also sell bags of day old croissants (3 for $3).
The plain croissant is light, crisp, flaky, buttery, and has a decent crumb. The same can be said for the others. The almond croissant is interesting since it seems like the frangipane is rolled and baked in the croissant instead of being filled into a sliced open croissant, which gives it a different texture - not inherently a better or worse thing. The olive oil cake is rich and moist without reading as too dense on the palate (honestly surprised since it's pretty hefty and the oil seeps through the bag lol), though I'm not sure how I feel about the poppy seeds since they sometimes can be a little too crunchy/grainy.
Overall, I think J'aime is worth checking out - the pastries are good, the decor is welcoming, and it's priced pretty on par with the other bakeries in the area.

I had high hopes for this french bakery. It's cute for sure, but none of the pastries really moved me. I only tried the pastries and no coffee. I had the Lemon Pound Cake, Apple Turnover, Almond Croissant and Chocolate Croissant. 

The pound cake was dry enough said. The Apple turnover was delicious, very good ratio of filling to pastry and the flakiness was outstanding. Both the chocolate and almond croissant were on the overcooked side and I've had much better. 

Overall:
Lemon Pound Cake 2/5
Apple Turnover 5/5
Chocolate Croissant 3/5
Almond Croissant 3/5
Amazing pastries and baked goods. Bought some to share with coworkers and we can't stop talking about their super freshly baked croissants!
This place is incredibly quaint, and the staff is super attentive and genuine. The food is fresh- I would recommend a crepe or an almond croissant!
Cute, quiet and quaint little bakery in Centre City.  Pastry nice and flaky, just wish they were bigger!  The blueberries were fresh and the coolness against the light pastry - devine!  Enjoy!
Super cute and chic ! I love the atmosphere! I've been here a couple of times and I've never been displeased ! Their coffee and little desserts and magnificent!

I had a complicated order.  :-) Since I live in Miami, I am used to drinking Cortaditos, which is no more than a double Espresso with a hint of milk. The barista was friendly enough to comply and my c coffee turn out great.  I pair my coffee with a a great tasting croissant. Can't ask for more!!!!

It was my first time trying this bakery and I loved the service I got. She was really thorough about explaining the most popular pastries and her own recommendations. I ended up getting the choux cream puff with nutella cream, and it was amazing! Definitely recommend.

Was right around the corner from my hotel. Came for a quick pick me up drink in the morning before my exam prep class. Cappuccino was DELICIOUS. Came back later that day for another drink and the lemon tart because it was recommended by someone else. Haven't tried the tart yet (bringing it home to NJ!) but all of their pastries look fantastic!
Cute decor! We got the chocolate pretzel croissant, draft latte, and passion fruit iced tea
This place is so cute and the coffee tastes so good. It is very high quality coffee. I'd rate it a 6 out of 5 stars if I could. Very friendly atmosphere. Love it!
Love this place! I come here before work and everything is delicious!!! La Colombe coffee and fresh baguettes!! Yay!!
Super cute place, friendly staff and smells amazing! They offer dairy feee milks was well.

We came here looking at the high ratings here on Yelp. The place is small with a few indoor tables, but it was super crowded. It seems the place is surely a local favorite. They offer a variety of croissants, pastries, and crepes. They offer nondairy milk with coffees, otherwise, I didn't find any vegan items here. We wanted to sit down but there were already people waiting in the line to grab a place, so we had to opt for take out. My family loved the pastries. Overall, it's a cool place, my bad, I totally forgot to click photos.

A really good bakery! It has a nice and cozy, but modern atmosphere. The staff is also very friendly! When i went there I was pleasantly greeted w a display of desserts, and I would recommend the Paris Philadelphia! It's is good! It has almost a hazelnut taste while adorn w almonds!
Delicious croissants and sweets and good coffee. Pricey $$$. Wish there were croissant breakfast sandwiches.
Great place to do work with outlets and good wifi. Good coffee from la Colombe and lots of pastry options. The staff are also very friendly and overall a great experience at the cafe

Best croissant in the US - plainly and simply true!!!

Not only Philly is one of these US best kept secrets, now one may add this real French bakery, owned and run by a French national. 
And here is what you get - just the perfectly balanced croissant, which is even hard to find in Paris!!! Light and airy, super tasty. 
Everything else is equally great, not to mention the lovely personnel and the bright setting. 

PS: come and get your Bonne Maman jams over here too!!!
Great service and food. The wifi is fast for studying and has a lot of seating. The croissant was heated up and buttery. I also loved the draft latte

Delicious croissant and latte, my husband also really enjoyed his quiche and tea. The staff was friendly and the cafe looked comfortable to hang out in(after COVID of course) Would definitely return and recommend.
I find this place as one of my favorite cafes in Philly with awesome latte and delicious croissants. I highly recommend coming to this place to work or study as well.

My girlfriend and I stopped by J'aime the Saturday after it's opening. There was a short line formed which moved fairly quickly. The selection of parties are displayed on the counter, and it seemed as though some were starting to sell out (or at least another batch had to be baked). We ordered the Sugared Chouquette with Whipped Cream, Paris Philadelphia, a Mocha, and a Cappucino. The drinks were solid, and had a nice froth to them, but the real stars were the pastries. The texture of the cream was perfect, and both had just the right amount of sweetness.

While the pastries are great, the prices can be a bit steep, especially for the chouquette. However, the service is friendly and the space is bright and clean.

J'aime is a well-executed French bakery with plenty of mouth-watering options, including some exceptional pastries.

What an adorable bakery! I came here with a group of ladies after the 5k in Philly for Breast Cancer. We saw it from the outside and HAD to go in. There were so many appetizing options to chose from that were all french. 

We were greeted by the baristas and they were delighted to help us out. Our order consisted of croissants, meringue cakes, apple turnovers, Madeline's,  and a few espressos. 

Everything was to die for and we will certainly be back. The employees were very helpful and they even encourage yelp discounts if you write a review.

Fabulous bakery with kind and caring employees! I had pre-ordered a dozen chocolate croissants for Mother's Day and when I got to the bakery, they did not know what I was talking about. I was pretty upset, as I had specifically called before hand so I could be prepared. The employees apologized profusely and offered me a small box of free macaroons to enjoy while I waited the 20 minutes for the croissants to bake. The croissants were so delicious and the iced americano with oat milk was smooth and creamy, just the way I like it. I will definitely be back!

We found J'aime French Bakery by using the Yelp app, which guided us easily to their front door. My fiance and I stopped into J'aime French Bakery to grab a quick coffee. Boy, were we glad we did. The atmosphere was very inviting and the pastries looked delectable. There were many options to choose from in their pastry case. We tried the chocolate croissant, which was one of the best I have ever had. Just the right amount of flakiness and gooey chocolate. While I didn't try the coffee, my Fiance said it was tasty. Some of their pastries were on the pricer end ($10 for a sand dollar sized quiche) but I'm sure if it was as good as my croissant I wouldn't mind.
This is a real gem in the neighborhood. Pastries and coffee are both spit on. Dining inside is super comfortable

What a lovely little place this is! The first thing we need to talk about is the decor of this place! It's cute and quaint and I could sit here all day. The lighting and airiness make it feel so cozy! Next, the iced Black and Tan is AH-MAZI G! Get the large because you'll be sad when the smaller one finishes! It's got a great consistency and really wakes you up! Finally, get one of their baked goods! There are tons of little treats to choose from and I aim to try them all at some point! The banana Nutella crepe is def a favorite for me and the tarts are fantastic! Get that bread literally!

Hubby and son wanted crepes for breakfast and when these two want something very specific, I have to oblige.  The crepes are amazing, I don't know how they can get them to be such an uniform color and texture, and make them so light!  We also tried the mushroom spinach quiche, pain au chocolat and some pastries.  The food is delightful and the coffee is awesome and strong.  I took off one star because of the fact that tables are not cleaned on a timely basis.  This is a high turnover place, with many customers choosing to stay and eat in, so someone really needs to keep an eye on the tables and as soon as one party leaves, wipe the table, especially these days.  Both mornings that we had breakfast here, I had to do so myself, thankfully, I always carry sanitizing wipes.

I came here during outfest as I wanted coffee and this shop was in my face. When I walked in, the baristas were friendly. I ordered the Pure Black/Draft Latte mix which I was actually surprised that it tasted so good without the need to add any sugar or dairy. Bakery ambiance was nice too. Very cute

Cute store that is small dog friendly! Very chic interior with very friendly staff. They missed my sandwich order which was a bummer but other pastries were satisfying. The lemon tart was too sweet for me but the pastry on the Napoleon was super flaky and lovely and the blueberry galette was the perfect amount of sweet.

Thinking about making J'aime my new spot for pastries in the morning whenever I need to stop by my office. Move over, Starbucks! 

The entire place is appealing. I didn't really know what to expect when I got there, but I loved it. They had a sign displayed outside that stated only 2 customers were allowed in at a time and masks are required. 
Inside, it was bright and airy, the music was soft and the pastries looked heavenly. J'aime also sells baguettes and other breads. The girls behind the counter who took care of us were such sweeties and offered to cut up a loaf of bread into slices for my friend who accompanied me. 

I got the lemon tartlet because for some odd reason I wasn't craving anything chocolatey. It sat in the refrigerator for most of the day because I wanted to ensure the merengue stayed in tact. When I got home, I cracked the box open and went to town! The lemon flavor was absolutely perfect. Not too tangy and not too sweet. The merengue was fluffy and melted in my mouth. Crust was buttery and flaky. There's no reason why someone would hate this thing. I noticed they have a berry tartlet available so that's next on my list to try. 

Overall, a VERY cute French bakery with several options for everyone! Definitely recommend J'aime for your morning cup of Joe and a delicious bakery item.

Have you been looking for a fun place to enjoy a coffee and chat with a friend? Or a bright place to settle down and study or answer emails? Or even just a place to grab a quick pastry during those afternoon doldrums? Well look no further: J'aime French Bakery is the spot for you.
This small cafe/bakery on 12th street has some of the best french patisseries in town: ranging from fluffy and airy croissants, to perfectly filled eclairs, and buttery tartlets. I'm a sucker for chocolate croissants, and this place has the best ones I've found in Philadelphia. You can see and taste the separate layer of the pastry, and the outside has a perfect slightly crispy texture. The bittersweet chocolate inside is also delicious. If you're lucky enough to be at the bakery when they're baking a fresh batch, you can even score one hot out of the oven! I believe there are also some savory pastry options, but I have yet to try these. 
They also have a variety of coffee options encompassing espresso drinks and la colombe drafts; you'll definitely find something to get your caffeine fix. 
The ambiance is also something to note! The windows and white decor make the space very open and inviting. While some coffee shops feel cramped by copious tables and scarce light bulbs, this one feels comfortable and spacious. If you can get a table by the windows, you can even people-watch (one of my favorite activities)!
Overall, going to J'aime is a delightful experience--both for the food and the atmosphere.

I very much enjoyed this quaint place. It's very small and there are not a lot of seating options. If you're going to study or get work done, I'm not sure if they have outlets by the tables. But they are a great place to go to read a book or visit with friends. They have have wonderful coffee, macarons, and other sweet treats. It's very authentically French.

This is one of my favorite spots in Philly now, purely because of the quality of the pastries. I ordered an almond croissant and small drip coffee, and my friend got the plain croissant and apple turnover. The almond croissant was amazing. At $3.25 it isn't cheap but certainly a good price for breakfast if you're a light eater. It is flaky on the outside, and on the inside it's so soft that it's difficult to discern one delicate layer from the next. It's also lined with a light almond paste and coated with roasted sliced almonds. Hands down the best croissant I've had outside of Europe. The drip coffee also wasn't bad, at $2.50 - I appreciated that they had almond milk in the sugar and creamers section.

Highly recommend grabbing coffee and basically anything on the menu at this amazing bakery! The quiche Lorraine is addictive and I could've had a dozen chocolate croissants. Perfect place to stop for breakfast, a lunch meeting, an afternoon pick-me-up treat, or reconnecting with friends. I loved the atmosphere and the owner/pastry chef is incredibly talented!

I'd give this place 10 stars if I could. The customer service was over the top and the staff were so cheery and welcoming. You could tell they enjoy coming to work. The latte in the picture isn't from there but I got the smoked salmon with spinach on a baguette. The baguette itself was delicious, it felt like I was back in Paris all over again. I've been searching for smoked salmon on a baguette for years trying to recreate that experience when I was in Europe and this was by far the closest I've gotten. Everything was great quality.
The views are also great, it's nice having the buildings engulf your sight while you're eating. 
ALSO! I left my drink there for some reason and I actually came back to get it and they had saved it for me!!! Like how sweet is that? And the owner was cracking jokes about it. Small stuff like that seems so insignificant but I swear it brightened up my day. Made my crazy life more bearable!! Best way to gain a returning customer. Be sure to check them our, you won't be disappointed!!
The prior reviews are right on. Absolutely one of the best croissants I've had. If you're a croissant lover, it's a must try.
I went to get croissant for my son at 1:20pm and they were already out of almost everything. No plain croissant, no almond croissant, 4 or 5 other pastry pieces. Pathetic. Why were they even open?

Ve magnifique. Absolutely delightful. Chef brought out our food. Very authentic French pastries. Absolutely insane chocolate croissants. Awesome coffees. Great location. Eat in or on the go.love it and can't wait to go back.

Absolutely Amazing!!! Although I was disappointed there wasn't any brioche prepared and available in the case - the Apple Tart and the Napoleon were outstanding! I expected the Apple pastry to be soft but it was actually sugared carmelized and it was so incredible! The Napoleon pastry was perfectly flaky with a beautiful creme! Finally - just a simple Caramel latte with added vanilla was FANTASTIC coffee! If I lived in Philly- I would be a regular no question! HIGHLY RECOMMEND!
Stopped by this cute bakery while in Philly. Pastries were delicious and the staff was helpful in finding me things that would stay good in a suitcase.

I was walking down 12th St. and happened upon J'aime Bakery - I'd never been there before. I went in, and, since it was a French bakery, was going to have one of the croissants.  However, one pastry caught my attention - the chocolate pretzel. It's a croissant, shaped like a pretzel, with a smooth chocolate ganache running through it, and small baked almonds sprinkled on top. I bought one, left the store and began walking and eating the pastry. The light, buttery croissant, the velvety texture of the ganache and crunchy almond, stopped me in my tracks a few blocks away. I turned around.........and walked back for another (which I ate today)
You don't find pastry gems like this one very often...I'll be back soon!

This has been my favorite place to get coffee and pastry's in Philly since it opened 4 years ago. The staff is kind and welcoming (They go above and beyond). The owner is a brilliant pastry chief. The shop is beautiful, clean, and has wifi!

The pastry's are always fresh and the coffee is always hot. I cannot recommend J'aime enough!

This cafe has food options that are not listed but are on display, I tired to purchase a Quiche and an Iced Coffee and my total was mind blowingly $15... I had only brought $14 with me because no cafe I've ever been to for breakfast has cost close to that.  When I confessed I was a $1 short, they threw the quiche away... Over priced, I hope this place makes it.... no other coffee shop in this place has been able to.

Recently discovered this bakery and it has the best pastries. Their chocolate pretzel is different from anything I've ever tried and in the best way! It is so so good! Their espresso drinks are also amazing. Make sure to come early before things start selling out!
Delicious pastries and coffee. Friendly service too! We visit whenever we are in town!

Located in the Gayborhood in Center City Philadelphia, J'aime French Bakery is a local joint that has some really delicious pastries! Here's what I got

Orange Olive Bread: 
Moist and filled with delicious poppy seeds, this was the surprise of the trio of pastries we got. With a hint of citrus, it was balanced and delicious!

Lemon Tart: 
Topped with meringue peaks, the lemon tart was a little bit too sweet for my liking. The texture and presentation though were spot on!

Merveilleux:
Creamy, rich, and not too sweet, this meringue ball of joy was the highlight of our snack here. Yummy!

I highly recommend coming here to check out this spot and experiencing the great vibes and pastries if you're ever in the area!

I returned and was less impressed. They seem to be running down their selection of very French Kusmi tea in favor of decidedly un-French Harney & Sons. I got a millefeuille, which they call also un-Frenchly call a Napoleon, and it had only one layer of custard between two thick layers of pastry sheets. In a true millefeuille, you are supposed to get a nice mixture of the pastry part and the custard part with each bite, but with this there was too much dry pastry in one part of my mouth while the custard was in another. For $5.50, it was a significant disappointment. I'll be sticking to Miel for my pastries from now on.
Loved the service here! Best thing so far was the croissants! Cold brew was 7/10, but I would go back just because of the atmosphere!

Fresh, beautiful and delicious pastries! I bought a bunch of goodies for friends and I got a huge thumbs up and ear-to-ear grin from everyone!

The prices are very reasonable for the quality they offer. I bought 7 pastries (each of their croissants, a heart-shaped napoleon, an eclair and an orange tart) and a small latte for a little over $30.

The latte was good but nothing extraordinary compared to the bakery items.

The interior is honestly so beautiful. The simple yet sophisticated white-walled design is perfect. And they even put decorations for Christmas! A little effect place to catch up with friends! A nice place for brunch.

Why only 4 stars? Honestly the service wasn't amazing in my opinion. The cashier did her job but she wasn't that friendly. But she wasn't unfriendly either. No WiFi either :(

Would come again!

Lovely! I love pastry shops in France! It is hard to find delicate pasties here. Ordered these through Uber Eats to serve on a private jet. Beautiful pastries that will please all! Each delicate pastry was as delicious as the next. Amazing flakey layers of delight! The cream filled items were a favorite, however, honestly everything was a favorite. If you can pick up a variety of the $6 pastries you won't be disappointed. If choosing only one, the light fluffy cream filled selections are extra special. 

I ordered one of just about everything on their "pastry" menu. Thank you so much for offering such a wide selection of beautiful French pastries.
Great atmosphere! The pastries look delicious the second you walk in, really friendly staff :)

My favorite croissant in the city! Just perfectly executed, such a joy to eat. Everything I have had from Bastian's bakery is wonderful (although I don't have too much of a sweet tooth so I haven't tried the dessert-y sweet treats). Highly recommend the croissant, pain aux raisins, and almond croissant but I bet you can't go wrong across the board (the little quiches look particularly cute).

Oh.so.GOOD!! Everything about this place is fantastic. It's been on my list of places to visit and finally was able to stop it. 

Chilly, rainy, fall day, what's not to like about a nice warm bakery? I got an almond cappuccino (soy & almond ate their dairy free options) and almond croissant. What really blew me away was that the filling WAS STILL WARM!! I debated buying more while we were sitting chatting in the bakery because it was SO GOOD! 

Actually said to my friend, "it's a good thing I don't live closer because I would be here way more often." So good. Will absolutely be back!

Super awesome and cute little shop. I appreciate they checked vaccinated status. The staff was extremely attentive and nice. They helped me pick out the right pastries for me. Would recommend and going back

I stopped by this lovely little bakery in Center City on my way to a friends house. I ordered an orange olive oil cake, chocolate pretzel croissant, and regular chocolate croissant. All were superb!! The olive oil cake was out of this world and I'm determined to try and recreate it in the near future. The pretzel croissant had an interesting crunchy topping and great texture in general. This place also serves La Colombe coffee which is my favorite coffee, as an avid tea drinker & occasional coffee drinker.
Almond croissant, raisin pastry -so good - vanilla latte - delicious breakfast in a cute place. Quick and friendly service.

Let me start this review off by saying, I'm still dreaming about the quiche I had for a late breakfast last week...

I finally got a chance to check this place out and loved it! It is pretty darn cute! Very clean and chic, with floor to sealing windows at the front which bring in a lot of sunlight. 

As soon as you walk in, you'll see some perfectly baked and beautifully arranged pastries - your eyes are sure to get a treat! Everything looks fantastic! I would normally go for a chocolatey pastry, but since it was my first bite of the day, I was feeling something savory... alas the quiche. I was informed that the quiche can go fast, so I wasn't going to risk not being able to try it!

After one of the sweet staff members warmed it up for me like I asked, she brought it out to the table. Simply put: it was divine. The quiche was flakey and oh so tasty. It came with a side salad (fresh spinach and tomatoes with dressing), but to be honest, it was really hard to focus on the salad with that quiche on the side.

I'm sure I'll be returning to J'aime again when I want to treat myself. I'm not sure what I'll get though. It would be difficult to pass up on that quiche, but I'm also very interested in trying one of their pastries. Perhaps I'll do a little indulging and get both? Who knows! All I know is, J'aime, I'm coming for ya!

Two words: lemon tart! Cannot say enough about this perfectly prepared treat. So yummy! As is all the pastries I've enjoyed at J'aime. Also the staff is fantastic. They know how to hustle and that is always appreciated. The place is very clean and staff always masked.

Was looking for a treat and a good cup of coffee on a Sunday and was very excited to see that there's a new bakery in town. 

The ambiance is very cute. Bright, clean, and new-- with a hint of industrial. Very inviting and nice to come in and sit. Airy and open. 

The service was great- the barista was great about explaining different options and was extremely friendly. 

I enjoyed the 'black and tan' -- la Colombe iced black coffee with the la colombe draft latte (nitrogen foamed latte) on top -- makes for a very tasty, frothy drink. I also had the chouquette with Nutella cream -- YUM. Flaky, airy pastry with rich Nutella cream in the center. A perfect complement to the bitter coffee. 

Only thing I can knock this place on is price-- two small coffees and the one pastry came out to $15, so it's more than I'd typically pay for something comparable. 

Overall, a great experience. Definitely recommend stopping in!

I'm so thrilled to discover this wonderful French  pastry!!!! As a dessert lover, I'm craving for a delicate pastry shop in Philly (where it is hard to find except the Korean Paris Baguette...). I'm soooooooo glad to discover this little place! The croissants are both crispy and soft at the same time. You can taste the delicate thoughts put into these bakery. Definitely will come more often!!

Came to Philly for the weekend, and stopped into this new French Bakery my friend told me about. Split a lemon tart and chocolate cream chouquette with my friend. We fought over the last piece of lemon tart, which had a ring of torched meringue around the edges. WOW! 

It is styled after traditional French bakery, serving up delicious croissants and brioche with your coffee, tarts by 11am, and then quiches for lunch... I guess I'll have to stop by every hour, on the hour to try it ALL. Looking forward to this place blowing up!
Best croissants around! Truly authentic. Everything we have tried has been great.  Love this place!

I have to say, I'm not a fan of the decor. The clean white look can work in some situations, but I feel like it usually needs some warm wood tones to balance it out, and J'aime is lacking that. It's just pure white, and it seems very un-French and cold. However, the pastries are delicious and very French. I really wanted a millefeuille/Napoleon but they had none, so I tried a Paris Philadelphia, which was a rectangle of hazelnut chocolate delectability. I also had hot tea, but oddly, though they appear to sell loose-leaf, they served me a bag of not-whole-leaf tea. France was way ahead of the States with loose-leaf (it was where I learned to love it!), so I feel like J'aime should up their game. I also got a sourdough baguette to go; it was pretty good, but not worth going out of your way for. Come for the pâtisseries!
A slice of heaven! I couldn't believe this place was so close to my house and I've never been! Got the chocolate croissant, lemon tart, and eclair and they were all phenomenal!
Absolutely the place to go. Great coffee, wonderful quiches,  awesome lemon tart and all with great service and smiles.

Authentic French bakery, a French owner & Baker, managed by an authentic stylish French lady with a French accent! It feels like France in there :) I love this place! 
The space is an awesome transformation from the last cafe. All white, with a long white bar. Bold glass chandeliers, and lots of French charm.
The cases are filled with Nutella-whipped cream chouquettes, a Bouche de Noel, croissants, chausson au pommes (my fave) and pain Au chocolates. It's the real deal, authentic French pastries right here!!! The owner makes them all! 
I will be back very soon!

No idea how I'm the first to review this place. The pastries were delicious and they have draft La Colombo Coffee, what could be better? Not only was the food great, but it's also a beautiful space - from the high ceilings to the greenery. The only con is they ran out of croissants, but it only took waiting an extra 8 minutes for a hot one right from the oven. Definitely will be returning!
